penguin.posix_aio – The Posix Interface For Aync I/O¶

penguin.posix_aio.aio_cancel()¶

cancel an outstanding aio operation

Parameters:
  • fd (int) – file descriptor of the operation(s) to cancel
  • aiocb (aiocb) – the specific aio operation to cancel (default of None means attempt canceling everything outstanding for the fd)
Returns:

one of the constants AIO_CANCELED, AIO_NOTCANCELED, or AIO_ALLDONE
penguin.posix_aio.aio_error()¶

get the error status of an aio operation

Parameters:aiocb (aiocb) – the aiocb representing the aio operation
Returns:int, the direct return value of aio_error(3)
penguin.posix_aio.aio_fsync()¶

queue an asyncronous request for an fsync

Parameters:
  • op (int) – the fsync operation to perform: if O_SYNC then it behaves like fsync(2), if it is O_DSYNC then it behaves like fdatasync(2).
  • fildes (int) – file descriptor for which to sync completed aio operations
  • signo (int) – signal to send when the fsync completes (default 0 for none)
penguin.posix_aio.aio_read()¶

queue an asynchronous read from a file descriptor

Parameters:
  • fildesc (int) – file descriptor to read from
  • nbytes (int) – maximum number of bytes to read
  • offset (int) – offset of the file to start the read from (default 0)
  • signo (int) – signal to send when the read completes (default 0 for none)
Returns:

an aiocb, which can be used to get the read results
penguin.posix_aio.aio_return()¶

get the return status of an aio operation

Parameters:aiocb (aiocb) – the aiocb representing the aio operation
Returns:int, what the return value of the synchronous call would have been
penguin.posix_aio.aio_write()¶

queue an asynchronous write to a file descriptor

Parameters:
  • fildes (int) – file descriptor to write to
  • data (str) – the data to write into the file descriptor
  • offset (int) – offset of the file to start the write from (default 0)
  • signo (int) – signal to send when the write completes (default 0 for none)
Returns:

an aiocb, which can be used to get the write return value
penguin.posix_aio.read_aiocb_buffer()¶

get the contents of the buffer of an aiocb object

Parameters:
  • aiocb (aiocb) – the aiocb object from a previous aio operation
  • nbytes (int) – the number of bytes to retrieve
Returns:

string, contents of the aiocb struct’s buffer
